questionnaire_description: Taking into account the description and aim of the exercise and observing the repetition, answer the questions by assigning the number associated with the answer

exercise_stages.stage_1: The subject holds a bar with both hands and with arms extended along the body, slightly apart.
exercise_stages.stage_2: The subject must raise their arms above the head and as high as possible, keeping the elbows in extension in order to stretch the trunk muscles.
exercise_stages.stage_3: Subject lowers the arm to go back to starting position.

body segment terminology.arm raise angle: angle between the arm and torso in the sagittal plane for each arm
body segment terminology.elbow extension angle: angle between the upper arm and forearm for each arm
body segment terminology.knee extension angle: angle between the thigh and the calf for each leg
body segment terminology.hands distance: distance between the tips of the hands
body segment terminology.hip angle: angle between the thigh and the torso in the frontal plane for each leg

PO_questions.x: Is the left arm raise angle maximized?
PO_questions.y: Is the the right arm raise angle maximized?
PO_questions.1: Are the metrics in the above 2 questions achieved in the exercise?
PO_questions.2: Is the exercise carried out in a constant manner throughout? Is rise time equal to fall time?
PO_questions.3: Is the amplitude of the movement complete in the exercise? Is the amplitude maximized at the middle frame?

CF_questions._comment: # Default answer for questions a to h should be 2. DO NOT include this field in the result.
CF_questions.a: Is the hands distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.b: Is the ankle distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.c: Are the elbow extension angles symmetrical and constant across both arms in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.d: Are the knee extension angles symmetrical and constant across both legs in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.e: Is the frontal area enclosed by left shoulder, right shoulder, left hip, and right hip constant in ALL 5 frames?
CF_questions.f: Are the hip angles symmetrical and constant across both legs in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.g: Are the feet on the ground, slightly apart, with the knees slightly flexed in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.h: Is subject free of ANY anterior or posterior pelvic tilt in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.4: Based on your answer for e, is the posture of the head correct?
CF_questions.5: Based on your answer for a and c, is the posture of the right arm correct?
CF_questions.6: Based on your answer for a and c, is the posture of the left arm correct?
CF_questions.7: Based on your answer for e, f, and h, is the posture of the trunk correct?
CF_questions.8: Based on your answer for e, f, and h, is the posture of the pelvis correct?
CF_questions.9: Based on your answer for b, d, and g, is the posture of the right leg correct?
CF_questions.10: Based on your answer for b, d, and g, is the posture of the left leg correct?
